artefact: Camping exemption certificates (England, Scotland and Wales)

artefact.alternative_title: Camping and caravanning exemption certificates (England, Scotland & Wales)
artefact.overview: A camping or touring caravan exemption certificate is a certificate which allows a recreational organisation to camp or caravan on land without a site licence or the need to apply for planning permission
artefact.licence_short_description: A camping or touring caravan exemption certificate is a certificate which allows a recreational organisation to camp or caravan on land without a site licence or the need to apply for planning permission.
artefact.licence_overview:
A camping or touring caravan exemption certificate is a certificate which, in certain circumstances, allows a recreational organisation to camp or caravan on land without a site licence or the need to apply for planning permission.

Applications in England are made to Natural England and in Wales and Scotland to their respective Regional Assemblies.

Online applications, using the form from [Natural England,](http://www.naturalengland.org.uk/ "Natural England"){:rel="external"} can be made for Scotland and Wales and these will be forwarded to the relevant Regional Assembly.
